pingball.simulation.collidable

Class MovingCircle

  • java.lang.Object
    • pingball.simulation.collidable.MovingCircle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Collidable

    public class MovingCircle
extends java.lang.Object
implements Collidable
    A mutable moving circle MovingCircle object is a circle that represents a ball. It has the center, radius, and velocity. The density of moving circle is 1 unit mass per unit length^3 Rep-Invariant: -

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MovingCircle(physics.Vect center, double radius, physics.Vect velocity)
      Create a MovingCirle object

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovingCircle

        public MovingCircle(physics.Vect center,
            double radius,
            physics.Vect velocity)
        Create a MovingCirle object
        Parameters:
        center - a vector representing the center location of the MovingCircle
        radius - a double number representing the radius. Must be nonnegative
        velocity - a vector representing the velocity direction and magnitude

    • Method Detail

      • getCircle

        public physics.Circle getCircle()
        Return a Physics.Circle object referencing the position and radius of this MovingCircle
        Returns:
        the Physics.Circle object that has the position and radius of this MovingCircle

      • timeUntilCollision

        public double timeUntilCollision(Ball ball)
        Return the it takes for this object to collide with the ball. If the collision will not occur, this method return Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY.
        Specified by:
        timeUntilCollision in interface Collidable
        Parameters:
        ball - the ball that will collide with this object
        Returns:
        a double representing the time it takes for this object to collide with the ball

      • collide

        public void collide(Ball ball)
        Collide this object with ball, changing the velocity of the ball and this object if this object. This method assume the two objects are at the point of impact. Note that this method mutates this object as well as the ball.
        Specified by:
        collide in interface Collidable
        Parameters:
        ball - the ball that will collide with this object

      • move

        public void move(double time)
        Move this object for some time.
        Parameters:
        time - a double representing the time that this object will be simulated to move

      • getMass

        public double getMass()
        Return the mass of this MovingCircle. Note that the density is 1 unit mass per unit length^3
        Returns:
        the mass of this object

      • getVelocity

        public physics.Vect getVelocity()
        Return the velocity of this object
        Returns:
        the velocity of this object

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity(physics.Vect velocity)
        Set the velocity of this object
        Parameters:
        velocity - a vector representing the direction and magnitude of the new velocity for this object

      • setCenter

        public void setCenter(physics.Vect center)
        Set the center location of this object
        Parameters:
        center - the vector representing the new location of this object

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Rotate this object by a particular angle corresponding to the center of rotation
        Specified by:
